resources.string: 주변의 관찰 기록을 불러올 수 없습니다: %1$s
사용자 이름과 비밀번호가 일치하지 않습니다. 다시 로그인 해주시기 바랍니다.
iNaturalist 계정으로 로그인 하시거나 새로운 계정으로 가입하시기 바랍니다.
당신의 현재 위치를 찾기 위해 위치 서비스를 활성화 하십시오.
웹사이트 창으로 로그인 하려면 인터넷 권한이 필요합니다.
페이스북 계정이 잠겨있습니다. www.facebook.com으로 로그인하고 재설정 후 다시 시도해 보세요.
페이스북 계정을 다시 연결하기 위해 앱에 로그인 해주십시오.
페이스북 비밀번호가 바뀐 상태입니다. 페이스북 계정으로 다시 연결하려면 이 앱에 다시 로그인 해야 합니다.
페이스북 계정을 다시 연결하기 위해 앱에 로그인 해주십시오.
이 앱으로 할 권한이 없습니다. 권한을 변경하기 위해 이 앱에 다시 로그인을 시도해보세요.
저장되지 않은 변경 내용이 취소됩니다. 계속 진행하시겠습니까?
아직 작성된 의견/생물 종 정보가 없습니다.
선택한 목록에서 해당 생물 분류군이 없습니다.
\'%1s\' 필드를 위한 정확한 값을 입력해 주십시오
내가 참여하는 프로젝트를 보려면 로그인해야 합니다.
iNaturalist의 설립과 디자인은 캘리포니아 과학원에서 지원하였습니다.

string-array.name: tutorial_descriptions
string-array.item: Get outside! Find something wild, and take a clear, full frame photo.
Share your observation with the iNaturalist community.
Check back for comments and identifications on your observation!
Research Grade observations are shared with scientists working to better understand and protect nature.

resources.string: 정말 로그아웃 하시겠습니까? 진행시 회원님의 기기에 저장된 모든 관찰 기록이 삭제됩니다. 물론, iNaturalist에 등록한 관찰 기록에는 영향을 미치지 않습니다.
죄송합니다. 저희는 구글 드라이브나, 드롭박스 등 기타 웹하드에서 사진을 업로딩 하는 것을 지원하지 않습니다. 휴대하신 기기에 사진을 저장한 후 다시 시도해보세요.
iNaturalist의 메인 네트워크입니다. 확인을 누르면 회원님의 앱을 전세계 iNaturalist 네트워크에 등록합니다.

NaturaLista is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Mexico. Local institutions supporting NaturaLista will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

iNaturalist NZ is a member of the iNaturalist Network in New Zealand. Local institutions supporting iNaturalist NZ will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

iNaturalist Canada is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Canada. Local institutions supporting iNaturalist Canada will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

Naturalista is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Colombia. Local institutions supporting Naturalista will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

Biodiversity4All is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Portugal. Local institutions supporting Biodiversity4All will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

iNaturalist Panamá is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Panama. Local institutions supporting iNaturalist Panamá will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

iNaturalist Ecuador is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Ecuador. Local institutions supporting iNaturalist Ecuador will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

iNaturalist Australia is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Australia. Local institutions supporting iNaturalist Australia will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?

ArgentiNat is a member of the iNaturalist Network in Argentina. Local institutions supporting ArgentiNat will have access to your email address and access to the true coordinates for observations that are publicly obscured or private. Please do not experimentally change your affiliation if you have more than 1000 observations. Would you like to change your affiliation?
안내서 편집자는 이 특색이 드러나게 작성해야 합니다.
%1$s에 관련된 데이터를 저장합니다. 이후에 인터넷 접속이 안될 때에도 이 안내서를 이용 할 수 있습니다.
안내서의 세부내용을 검색하지 못했습니다 - 네트워크 오류일 가능성이 있습니다.
iNaturalist 에 처음 오셨습니까? 도와드리겠습니다. (버젼 %1$s - %2$s; 사용자 아이디 - %3$s
예, 게시물 사용 권한을 설정하여 과학자들이 나의 게시물을 이용할 수 있게 합니다. 더 알아보기
게시하신 사진에 비영리사용-저작자표시 허가을 부여하고 싶다면 \'여기\'를 누르세요. 회원님은 다른 저작권 형태를 부과하거나 저작권을 삭제 할 수 있습니다. 하지만 비영리사용-저작자표시가 연구자들과 공유하기 가장 좋은 방법입니다.
작성한 안내서를 보려면 로그인 해야 합니다.
회원님의 업데이트를 보려면 로그인 해야 합니다.
By using iNaturalist you agree to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
설정에서 자동-동기화를 작동하면 관찰 기록이 자동으로 iNaruralist에 등록 됩니다.
관찰 지역을 추가하면 이 관찰 기록의 등급이 "생물 식별 필요"로 올라갑니다.
날짜을 추가하면 이 관찰 기록의 등급이 "생물 식별 필요"로 올라갑니다.
사진을 추가하면 이 관찰 기록의 등급이 "생물 식별 필요"로 올라갑니다.
사육/재배 중인 생물의 관찰 기록은 "일반 등급" 으로 설정 됩니다.
관찰 기록이 "연구 등급"으로 심사되려면 사람들의 생물 식별이 더 필요합니다.

위치정보 보호는 회원님이 관찰한 생물의 위치 좌표(위도와 경도)를 바꿀 수 있습니다. 다음과 같은 선택지가 있습니다:
공개 - 모든 사람이 멸종위기가 아닌 생물 종의 좌표를 볼 수 있습니다.
위치 불명료- 생물 종이 발견된 좌표로부터 위도 0.2º x 경도 0.2º 범위 내에서 무작위적으로 위치 좌표를 표시합니다. 이것은 적도 기준으로 484제곱킬로미터(22㎞x22㎞) 범위 내(극지방으로 갈 수록 좁아집니다)에서 위치 정보를 모호하게 만드는 것 입니다. 정확한 위치 정보는 관찰자와 관찰 기록을 등록한 프로젝트의 책임자만 알 수 있습니다.
비공개 - 관찰 생물이 발견된 위치 좌표를 공개하지 않습니다. 관찰자와 관찰 기록을 등록한 프로젝트의 책임자에게만 위치 정보가 공개됩니다.

관찰 기록을 등록한 프로젝트의 책임자는 회원님이 설정한 장소 공개여부와 관계 없이 항상 생물의 정확한 위치 좌표를 알 수 있습니다. 그래서 사람들이 정확한 위치 좌표에 접근하는 것이 우려된다면 참여하고 있는 프로젝트의 책임자를 항상 신뢰 할 수 있어야 합니다.
선택한 생물 종 정보를 삭제 하시겠습니까?
이 관찰 기록을 첫번째로 즐겨찾기에 등록해 주세요...
의견을 남기거나 생물 정보 확인을 추가 하려면 로그인 하거나 회원 가입을 해야 합니다.
즐겨찾기 목록을 보거나 관찰 기록을 즐겨찾기에 등록하려면 로그인하거나 회원 가입을 해야 합니다
Sync this observation to see faves...
Sync this observation in order to leave a comment or suggest an identification...
이 관찰 기록은 사육/재배 관찰 기록으로 보고되었습니다.
정말 이 관찰 기록을 사육/재배 관찰 기록으로 보고하시겠습니까? (예를 누르면 관찰 기록 창도 같이 닫힙니다)
프로젝트 세부 정보를 불러올 수 없습니다: %1$s
Are you sure you want to save the observation without any coordinates?
Are you sure you would like to remove your photo?
There was a problem while updating your profile!
There was a problem while updating your profile: %1$s
Auto-upload new observations and edits to observations

The iNaturalist Network is a framework for localizing the iNaturalist community. Network sites are supported by local institutions that have signed an agreement with iNaturalist to encourage local use and benefit local biodiversity.
Name what you saw if you can, even if that\'s just \"insect\" or \"bird,\" or just leave this blank. Others may help you identify it!
Check back soon for identifications and comments on your observation(s).
Import multiple photos by long-pressing on a single photo
Looks like there’s no recommendations in this area. Try moving to a new location.
Missions are realtime recommendations of what to look for around you. This way you can discover species new to you! (Requires connectivity)
Could not download latest observations - Connection problems. Try again later.
(You will only receive updates once you\'ve created observations)
(You will only receive updates once you\'re following observations)

It looks like you deleted a photo by clearing the app cache before uploading. You will need to add the photo back to your observation from your gallery. In the future, please make sure you have uploaded all your photos before clearing the app cache.

These are links to ancestors of this particular taxon. They are in order from coarser to more refined. Use these links to move up and down the Tree of Life. For example, if you don\'t know what an organism is, but know what grouping it falls into, tap on a taxon from the list to view more information about it.
We\'re not confident enough to make a recommendation, but here are our top %1$d suggestions:
We\'re pretty sure it\'s in this %1$s:
Suggest species based on visual similarity to photos.
Error importing photo(s): Can only import photo files with JPG/JPEG/PNG extensions
Please select a valid taxon from the list (or clear the taxon field).
The location or place you have searched is not in our database. Please choose a place from the list of options below the location search field or clear the search field.
Track identifications you suggest for observations by other people here.
This is a list of the species you have observed the most.\n\nFYI: There\'s an estimated 9 million species on the planet, so get out there and observe them!
Observations are records of your encounters with individual organisms at particular times and locations.
Are you sure you want to discard this comment?
Is the evidence provided enough to confirm this is %1$s?
I don\'t know but I\'m sure this is %1$s.
No, but it is a member of %1$s.
You must be connected to the Internet to load more observations
iNaturalist is a joint initiative by the California Academy of Sciences and the National Geographic Society.

iNaturalist exists thanks to every single person who participates in our community. The people who build the software, design the interfaces, maintain our infrastructure, support the community, and foster collaborations are Yaron Budowski, Amanda Bullington, Tony Iwane, Patrick Leary, Scott Loarie, Abhas Misraraj, Carrie Seltzer, Alex Shepard, and Ken-ichi Ueda.

CalTech and Cornell Tech helped develop the computer vision system that suggests identifications from photographs. We thank Grant Van Horn, Serge Belongie, and Pietro Perona for advancing the computer vision research. More information can be found at visipedia.org. Special thanks to NVIDIA for additional assistance.
The international iNaturalist Network supports localized, fully integrated, iNaturalist-based websites in the following countries, thanks to the support of associated partner organizations.

iNaturalist is also deeply grateful to the open source developers who have provided so much of the software we rely on every day. See https://github.com/inaturalist/iNaturalistAndroid for open source contributions.
We are grateful for the translation assistance provided by volunteers in the crowdin.com community, especially Eduardo Martínez, Lin Cheng-Tao, KestrelLam, cgalindo, vilseskog, NCAA, ldacosta, radana, Mykola Pukhalskyi, danieleseglie, and katunchik.
IUCN category II places provided by IUCN and UNEP-WCMC (2015), The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) [On-line], [11/2014], Cambridge, UK: UNEP-WCMC. Available at: www.protectedplanet.net
The password the app uses no longer works - did you change your password on the website? Please enter the new one here

Google requires us to ask for permission to access your contacts in order to use your Google Account, even though we do not access your contacts for any reason. If you deny this permission, you will need to sign up or login with a username and password.
Has ID supported by two or more
Community ID at species level or lower
Based on the evidence, can the Community ID still be confirmed or improved?
No, it\'s as good as it can be
Show scientific names before common names.
Canada: Canadian Wildlife Federation, the Royal Ontario Museum, NatureServe Canada, and Parks Canada operating iNaturalist Canada (inaturalist.ca)
Mexico: Comisión nacional para el conocimiento y uso de la biodiversidad (CONABIO) operating NaturaLista (NaturaLista.mx)
New Zealand: New Zealand Biodiversity Recording Network operating iNaturalist NZ — Mātaki Taiao (inaturalist.nz)
Portugal: Associação Biodiversidade Para Todos operating Biodiversity4All (Biodiversity4All.org)
Panama: Ministerio de Ambiente operating iNaturalistPa (panama.inaturalist.org)
Couldn\'t play sound - probably a network issue
To listen to Soundcloud sounds, view the website.
Couldn\'t retrieve sound from default recorder - try importing the sound instead
Import multiple sounds by long-pressing on a single sound
Sorry, but there was a problem loading the sound from this source
Error importing sound(s): Can only import sound files with WAV/MP3/AMR extensions

It looks like you deleted a sound by clearing the app cache before uploading. You will need to add the sound back to your observation from your gallery. In the future, please make sure you have uploaded all your sounds before clearing the app cache.
Clears up storage room on your phone
Number of days to store logs
Send Debug Logs From Start Date
Send debug logs by email (from specified start date)
Are you sure you want to delete all debug logs? Only press \'Yes\' if you want clear up storage room for your phone
No log files found for that date range - try earlier date?
Please try again in a few hours.

By deleting your account you will remove:

  • All of your observations, including the work of the all the people who have helped you out with identifications.
  • All of the identifications you\'ve added to the observations of other people, which will potentially affect the data quality of those observations.
  • All of the comments you\'ve added.

Furthermore, this action cannot be undone. If you change your mind later, you aren\'t getting any of that content back.

If this service generates too many notifications, consider editing your settings on the website to opt out of certain notifications or stop receiving email from us. If you\'re having trouble with a specific person, consider muting them instead of deleting your account.

If you\'re still sure you want to delete your account, enter \"%1$s\" in the form below and click the button to delete your account and all your data.
You must enter \'%1$s\' in the form to delete your account
There was an error deleting your account - please check your Internet connection
Do not collect stability and usage data using third-party services

We use a variety of third-party services to monitor stability and diagnose bugs and problems in our software. These third parties include:
  • Google (Google Analytics, Firebase Crashlytics)
  • New Relic

Information we share with these third parties include:
  • IP addresses (which can be used to derive location at city-level resolution, and to track you across different websites and services; note that we have enabled IP anonymization in Google Analytics and Firebase Crashlytics does not record IP address to our knowledge)
  • Browser details, like make, model, and version
  • Crash details, like exactly what line of code caused a crash
  • Device details, like make and model of a mobile phone

These third-party services provide enormous value to us in maintaining the stability and usability of iNaturalist with our relatively small staff. On mobile devices, there is almost no other way we can gain insight into problems that are occurring since the software is running on devices we do not control. Sometimes we aren’t even aware such problems are occurring until we see them in the data these services provide. By sharing this information, you are helping us serve you and the entire iNaturalist community.

Note that this option only applies to analytics and crash data that we are explicitly sending to these companies. All iNaturalist servers are provided and hosted by Microsoft, all iNaturalist images are hosted by Amazon, and almost all iNaturalist maps are served by Google, which means every time you look at an observation on iNaturalist, you are connecting to services provided by these companies and exposing your IP address to them, at the very least (in the iPhone app we use Apple’s maps). iNaturalist probably would not exist without the services these companies provide, and while we can limit the amount and kinds of data you share with them while using iNat, we cannot stop the flow of data entirely.
Tap to prioritize common names from a specific place.
